pages.text:
.entry-header
About Us
This is a story about resurrection. Or redemption. Or maybe a little bit of both!
In 1997, the City of Fort Myers pursued a dream to establish a fast speed ferry service to Key West. Partnerships, blueprints, leases, timetables and development ensued. Deals involved an operator out of Argentina to a boatyard in New York. In 1999, an impressive $1.6 million ferry terminal made its debut on the banks of the Caloosahatchee. $20,000 was set aside for the party that would herald the official start date of service… which never came.
Changing Plans
Perhaps now is a good time to take some inspiration from Thomas Edison who once wisely declared,
"Just because something doesn't do what you planned it to do doesn't mean it's useless."
The good news is Fort Myers successfully secured their ferry service to Key West which seamlessly operates from a much better location. One that doesn’t include 30 minutes of slow cruising through manatee inhabited low wake zones. That can be a wonderful experience unless you want to get somewhere fast. Like, you know, on a fast ferry.
A New Beginning
Let’s turn the clock forward to May 15, 2017, when the Fort Myers City Council officially accepted the recommendation from the City Selection Committee to move forward with Mainsail Lodging & Development, paving the way for the creation of a new waterfront restaurant in downtown Fort Myers. In March 2021, Oxbow Bar & Grill opened its doors as a causal dining retreat, showcasing both indoor and outdoor seating. A mixture of top quality retail encourages urban adventure with sportswear, gear, accessories and that souvenir or gift you never knew you couldn’t live without. The city-owned pier building at 1300 Hendry Street was reimagined into a chic rustic contemporary building, much like a repurposed original storefront or warehouse. Interiors exude a warmth through ceilings adorned with antique oars, modern brass lamping, Edison-style bulbs and stained oak with copper metal finishes. Creamy white walls, subway tiles and floors of large format porcelain tile keep things fresh and modern.
Our Unique Offerings
The second floor offers an unmatched venue for special events and private functions with its outdoor terrace, gracious bar, iron lanterns and stunning oyster shell chandelier. The overall experience is one of quiet luxury, an appreciation for the serendipity of the location and celebration of all that Fort Myers has to offer.
Private Events
Join us as we write the newest chapter for downtown Fort Myers!
Fun Fact:
The Fort Myers Pleasure Pier Complex was erected in 1927 just west of the Caloosahatchee River Bridge at the end of Carson Street. The pier was demolished in 1943, however, the upstairs pavilion was salvaged and barged upriver in two sections and placed on Edwards Drive. During World War II this structure served as a USO Center for soldiers stationed at the Buckingham Gunnery School and Page Airfield. Today, it’s known as the Hall of 50 States.
.entry-content .clear

.entry-header
Private Events
Private Events & Dining
With space for 20 to 120 attendees, our second-floor event space will perfectly conform to your specifications. No need to spend money on the decor with our jaw-dropping views and beautifully designed interior. Our events specialists look forward to bringing your vision to life!
Your guests will revel in the Florida sunshine or spectacular sunsets on our outdoor terrace overlooking the Caloosahatchee. Ideal for added flow during a reception or dramatic flair over a cocktail hour. The separate outdoor staircase adds convenient access and exclusivity.
Get In Touch
Panoramic Riverfront Views
Consider our second floor private event space for your celebration or business program, with 180 degree views of the Caloosahatchee River and sunset.
Virtual Tour
Drop Us a Line!
Our crew would love to hear about your upcoming occasion. Please complete our form below and we’ll be in touch.
Δ

Capacity Chart
Download Capacity Chart PDF

Thanks for your message! We’ll be in touch soon.
Join our Newsletter:
Oxbow is proud to be anchored within the Luminary Hotel & Co. family. Sign up for their newsletter to chart your course to exclusive offers and events!
Sign up Here!
Getting Here By Car:
Complimentary self-parking spaces are available in front of Oxbow on Hendry Street. Valet parking is available at Luminary Hotel & Co. for a $15 day rate. Self-parking is $1 per hour with a $15 maximum per exit. Additional parking can be found through metered spots on Hendry Street and Edwards Drive. Complimentary Zip Zone parking is on Bay Street and Hendry Street by Ella Mae’s Diner, extending on Hendry away from Luminary Hotel.
Getting Here By Boat:
While Oxbow does not currently offer boat docking slips, our neighbors at the
Fort Myers Yacht Basin
do.  Limited spots are available free of charge.  Boaters must call
239-321-7080
or radio the yacht master on channel 16 prior to confirm availability.
.entry-content .clear
